metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10883 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ext4 filesystem. A local user cancause an out-of-bounds write in jbd2_journal_dirty_metadata(), a denial ofservice, and a system crash by mounting and operating on a crafted ext4filesystem image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-142.168
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-142.168
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-142.168
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1103.111
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1107-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1107.112
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1075.85
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-45.48~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-45.48~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-45.48~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1037.39~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1027.28~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1040.46
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1032.34~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-142.168').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
